text.__SUMMARY__:
Salvia weihaiensis is an herb that is native to Shandong province in China, growing along the seashore. S. weihaiensis grows on erect stems to a height of 25 cm (9.8 in). Inflorescences are 2-8-flowered verticillasters in terminal racemess or panicles. It is related to Salvia japonica.


== Notes ==
